Lunarpine snapped upward catching the rock in his mouth, a move he 
never would have attempted if she were throwing the rocks with a 
robot arm. He spit it to the side keeping her location in the corner 
of his eyes. 

"You like being compared to a small week, pathetic bird that could 
be..."Her words hit him harder than any of the rocks she was 
throwing. "Beloved????????" the word rang through his ears making it 
hard to keep his mind on anything she said after that. 


The transformer had just been transformed into an open book, (A book 
with dogeared pages ha ha.) If shadow wing could read him she'd 
quickly skip to the end.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She smiled. She took another rock out and dropped it at him.
> "I'm no humming bird. But to be compared to such a flying gem is 
> praise indeed. Though I lack the colors of a humming bird, I thank 
> you for you kind words."
> She hoped that would get to him. "I would love to spar with you my 
> beloved friend. But as you can most likely tell, you have the upper 
> hand.  Since I can not out muscle you, I an trying to make you use 
> another muscle. One that you don't use very often."  She laughed 
out 
> loud hoping that would get to him. 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > The rock bounced off a low hanging branch. By throwing the rocks 
> with 
> > her beak she'd lost much of her accuracy. It landed about three 
> feet 
> > to his left. By hiding herself in the foliage she'd given up most 
> of 
> > her flying advantages. How to get up to where she was on the 
other 
> > hand, was Lunarpines main disadvantage. She thought out her 
> strategy 
> > well this time. If he could teach her to use those skills in a 
real 
> > battle she would easily survive every time.
> > 
> > "If I'd wanted to fight rocks then I wouldn't have needed a 
> sparring 
> > partner. So Come out and fight you overstuffed hummingbird." he 
was 
> > hoping to rattle her nerves, make her stop thinking for a few 
> > seconds. A wolf can't climb trees, but a bot can, all he needed 
was 
> > for her to lose her temper and give him an opening.
> >
